    • Method Detail

      • delivery

        void delivery​(int id,
              int amount)
        Receive a delivery of a particular product. Increase the quantity of the product by the given amount.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the product.
        amount - The amount to increase the quantity by.

      • findProduct

        inventory.Product findProduct​(int id)
        Try to find a product in the stock with the given id.
        Returns:
        The identified product, or null if there is none with a matching ID.

      • numberInStock

        int numberInStock​(int id)
        Locate a product with the given ID, and return how many of this item are in stock. If the ID does not match any product, return zero.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the product.
        Returns:
        The quantity of the given product in stock.

      • addProduct

        void addProduct​(inventory.Product item)
        Add a product to the list.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be added.

      • findProduct

        inventory.Product findProduct​(java.lang.String name)
        Try to find a product in the stock with the given name.
        Returns:
        The identified product, or null if there is none with a matching name.

      • lowStockProducts

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> lowStockProducts​(int upperLimit)
        Return arraylist of all the products which has stock levels below the given amount

      • orderStockProducts

        void orderStockProducts​(int stockTarget)
        Add the products which has stock levels below the given amount to the onOrder list, but only if they are not already on the onOrder list. Change the quantity field in onOrder list to the difference between the current number on hand and the stockTarget

      • loadSampleData

        void loadSampleData​(java.lang.String[][] data)
        Load the stock inventory with the Product information contained in the data provided as a parameter to the method. The data parameter is a 2d array of strings. Earch row index i of the 2d array data[i] contains three strings: data[i][0] is a string containing the id of the ith product data[i][1] is a string containing the name/description of the ith product data[i][2] is a string containing the quantity of the ith product Note: some of these values will need to be converted from String type to int type.

      • productCount

        int productCount()
        Return the number of different types of stock items in stock list.

      • findOrder

        inventory.Product findOrder​(java.lang.String name)
        Try to find a product in the orders with the given name.
        Returns:
        The identified product, or null if there is none with a matching name.
